1.text: Submerge the glue bottle in 8  fl oz (240 mL) of hot water for 5 minutes.

2.text: Swab the edges of the lid with white vinegar.

3.text: Wipe the lid with acetone nail polish remover.

4.text: Dip the nail glue lid into acetone nail polish remover if it’s very stuck.

5.text: Read the instructions on the nail glue’s label.

6.text: Insert a pin into the center of the nail glue tip or where indicated.

7.text: Replace the lid when you’re not using the nail glue.

8.text: Cut the tip off of your nail glue if you cannot puncture it.
